comments:
jVM terminated. Exit code=1
/usr/bin/java
-cp /opt/eclipse/startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
-os linux
-ws gtk
-arch x86
-showsplash /opt/eclipse/eclipse -showsplash 600
-exitdata /opt/eclipse/eclipse -exitdata 368008
-vm /usr/bin/java
-vmargs
-cp /opt/eclipse/startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main

Chris please provide a description / test case for this bug report.
It would appear that you are having trouble actually starting Eclipse? 
Not sure what that has to do with the Eclipse platform Ant integration?
Please reopen when more details are forthcoming.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Chris please provide a description / test case for this bug report.
> It would appear that you are having trouble actually starting Eclipse? 
> Not sure what that has to do with the Eclipse platform Ant integration?

Yes this problem occurred when starting up Eclipse
I was prompted for the working directory and entered this
and then the message appeared
Why did I select ant, simply because I was not sure of which option
to select and I had to select one. And I had seen that reference somewhere.

I still do not understand the Ant relationship but...

Anything printed to stdout? Any javacore file?

This could be a bug in your VM implementation.
Have you tried other VMs?
Specify a specific VM using the -vm option when starting Eclipse.

Likely a duplicate of bug 101689

This is the VM that is in the system path. It is not supported. You can tell
Eclipse what VM to use with the -vm command line option:

eclipse -vm <JAVA_HOME>/jre/bin/java


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 35995 ***

(In reply to comment #6)
> java.fullversion=GNU libgcj 3.3.5 (Debian 1:3.3.5-8)
>

I have started Eclipse with the -vm line as indicated "eclipse -vm
<JAVA_HOME>/jre/bin/java" (eclipse -vm /opt/jre/bin/java) and received this
error message:
JVM terminated. Exit code=1
/opt/j2sdk1.4.2_07/bin/java
-cp /usr/eclipse/startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
-os linux
-ws gtk
-arch x86
-showsplash /usr/eclipse/eclipse -showsplash 600
-exitdata /usr/eclipse/eclipse -exitdata 40003
-vm /opt/j2sdk1.4.2_07/bin/java
-vmargs
-cp /usr/eclipse/startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main 

After the Error box is closed the eclipse logo form stays up. Needs closing
manually.

I checked out the -cp /usr/eclipse/startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
and the pathes exist, I don't know if it means much but in
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main the main is main.class and the metod is defalted,
as in the explorer methos column.

Thank you for your support.

GCJ < 4.0 is not capable of running Eclipse.  Please update to a most recent 
version of GCJ.
